longDef.en: to exchange one thing for another thing, especially of a similar type

examples.en: She's just changed jobs.
examples.cn: 她刚换了工作。

examples.en: Let's change the subject (= talk about something different).
examples.cn: 我们换个话题吧。

longDef.en: to make or become different

examples.en: I almost didn't recognize her - she'd changed so much.
examples.cn: 我几乎认不出她了——她变化太大了。

examples.en: That was 20 years ago and things have changed since then.
examples.cn: 20年过去了，情况已经变了。

examples.en: Nothing changes, does it - I've been away two years and the office still looks exactly the same.
examples.cn: 什么也没有改变，不是吗——我走了两年，办公室看起来仍然是老样子。

examples.en: People have changed their diets a lot over the past few years.
examples.cn: 过去几年里人们的饮食习惯改变了许多。

examples.en: I'm going to change my hairstyle.
examples.cn: 我打算改变一下发型。

longDef.en: to take something you have bought back to a shop and exchange it for something else
longDef.cn: （将购买的东西拿回店里去）换，交换

examples.en: I had to change those trousers I bought for (= take them back to the shop in order to get) a bigger pair.
examples.cn: 我不得不把买来的裤子拿回去换了条大些的。

longDef.en: to form a new opinion or make a new decision about something that is different from your old one:
longDef.cn: 要是你改变主意今晚不来了，给我打个电话就行。

examples.en: If you change your mind about coming tonight, just give me a call.
examples.cn: 要是你改变主意今晚不来了，给我打个电话就行。

longDef.en: to improve:
longDef.cn: 她自从开始新工作后态度确实变好了。

examples.en: Her attitude has definitely changed for the better since she started this new job.
examples.cn: 她自从开始新工作后态度确实变好了。

longDef.en: to improve the bad parts of your behaviour:
longDef.cn: 要是他想继续在这儿住下去，就得改改样子，学着干净整洁一点。

examples.en: If he wants to carry on living here, he's going to have to change his ways and learn to be a bit less messy.
examples.cn: 要是他想继续在这儿住下去，就得改改样子，学着干净整洁一点。

longDef.en: to get off a train, bus, etc. and catch another in order to continue a journey
longDef.cn: 换乘，转乘（火车、公共汽车等）

examples.en: I had to change (trains) twice to get there.
examples.cn: 到那里我得换乘两次（火车）。

examples.en: Change at Peterborough for York.
examples.cn: 在彼得伯勒换车去约克。

longDef.en: to get or give money in exchange for money, either because you want it in smaller units, or because you want the same value in foreign money

examples.en: Could you change a £10 note (for two fives), please?
examples.cn: 请问你能把一张10英镑换开（换成两张5英镑）吗？

examples.en: Could you change a £5 note for me?
examples.cn: 你能为我换开一张5英镑的纸币吗？

examples.en: I need to change my dollars for/into English money.
examples.cn: 我需要把手头的美元换成英镑。

longDef.en: to remove one set of clothes and put a different set on yourself or a young child, especially a baby, or to remove dirty sheets from a bed and put clean ones on it

examples.en: You don't need to change - you look great as you are.
examples.cn: 你不用换衣服——这样看上去就很好。

examples.en: I'll just change into (= get dressed in) something a bit smarter.
examples.cn: 我要换一身更漂亮点的衣服。

examples.en: Give me five minutes to change out of (= remove) my work clothes and I'll come out with you.
examples.cn: 给我5分钟换下工作服就跟你出去。

examples.en: How often do you think he changes his shirt?
examples.cn: 你觉得他多久换一次衬衣？

examples.en: Could you change the baby (= the baby's nappy)?
examples.cn: 你能给婴儿换一下尿布吗？

examples.en: I've changed the sheets/the bed (= the sheets on the bed) in the guest room.
examples.cn: 我把客房的床单换过了。

longDef.en: When the wind or the tide (= the rise and fall of the sea) changes, it starts to move in a different direction.

examples.en: The tide is starting to change.
examples.cn: 潮水开始改向了。

longDef.en: to put a vehicle into a different gear, usually in order to change the speed at which it is moving

examples.en: to change gear
examples.cn: 换挡

examples.en: I changed into fourth (gear).
examples.cn: 我换到了第4挡。

examples.en: Change down to go round the corner.
examples.cn: 转弯要换到低挡。

longDef.en: the act of becoming different, or the result of something becoming different

examples.en: Let me know if there's any change in the situation.
examples.cn: 要是情况有了什么变化请告诉我。

examples.en: We're living in a time of great change.
examples.cn: 我们生活在一个大变革的时代。

examples.en: We need a change of government.
examples.cn: 我们需要换个政府。

examples.en: a change in lifestyle
examples.cn: 生活方式的改变

examples.en: They've made a lot of changes to the house.
examples.cn: 他们已对房子作了很多变动。

examples.en: The new management will make fundamental/radical/sweeping changes (= do things in a very different way).
examples.cn: 新的管理层会进行根本的／彻底的／大范围的变革。

longDef.en: something that is pleasant or interesting because it is unusual or new
longDef.cn: （令人愉快或有趣的）改进，改变

examples.en: It's nice to see her smile for a change.
examples.cn: 看到她笑了，真好。

examples.en: "Shall we we eat in the garden?" "Why not - it'll make a change."
examples.cn: “我们到花园里吃饭好吗?”“为什么不呢——这样会很新鲜。”

examples.en: We've always had a red car - it's time we had a change!
examples.cn: 我们的车总是红色的——该换一换了！

longDef.en: a new situation:
longDef.cn: 她在同一家公司已经干了好多年了，觉得需要换个环境，所以申请了一份舞台监督的工作。

examples.en: She'd been with the same company for too many years and felt she needed a change of scene, so she applied for a job as a stage manager.
examples.cn: 她在同一家公司已经干了好多年了，觉得需要换个环境，所以申请了一份舞台监督的工作。

longDef.en: money in the form of coins rather than notes

examples.en: She gave me €5 in change.
examples.cn: 她给了我5欧元的硬币。

examples.en: My dad always used to carry a lot of loose/small change (= coins) in his pocket.
examples.cn: 我爸爸以前口袋里总是装着许多硬币。

longDef.en: smaller units of money given in exchange for larger units of the same amount

examples.en: Do you have change for a 20-dollar bill?
examples.cn: 你能换开20美元的钞票吗？

longDef.en: the money that is returned to someone who has paid for something that costs less than the amount that they gave

examples.en: I think you've given me the wrong change.
examples.cn: 我想你找错我钱了。

longDef.en: the action of putting on different clothes

examples.en: She did a quick change before going on TV.
examples.cn: 上电视前，她迅速换了套衣服。

longDef.en: a set of clothes as well as the ones that you are wearing:
longDef.cn: 你要是在外面过夜，就需要带一套换洗的衣服。

examples.en: You'll need a change of clothes if you're staying overnight.
examples.cn: 你要是在外面过夜，就需要带一套换洗的衣服。

longDef.en: the action of getting off a train, bus, etc. and catching another in order to continue a journey

examples.en: I hate journeys where you've got a lot of changes.
examples.cn: 我讨厌频频换车的旅程。
